results.title: Air crossroads - London
results.creator_credit: John Arnold, Basic Films and Film Workshop, Central Office of Information
results.brief_description: London is the busiest airport in the world; 38 airlines use it and some 600 planes arrive and depart every 24 hours. Passengers from many nations pass through the airport and are assisted in every way posible by an efficient staff. The control tower and servicing staff are in operation seven days of the week, 24 hours a day. When passenger planes are not so numerous heavy freight planes take over. Radio control enables planes to land and take off in foggy weather and at night.

results.title: Air crew
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Thompson and Australia. Royal Air Force. Films Advisory Bureau
results.brief_description: The training of pilots and navigators for careers in the Royal Australian Air Force is described in detail. Young men with strong mathematical aptitudes excel in these fields, especially navigation. Training is carried out in a number of RAAF schools in different parts of the Commonwealth. The film closes with an account of life on the Australian base at Butterworth in Malaya.

results.title: Aids to independence
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Vintage Years”.
Outlines how elderly people can be assisted to live independently and the contribution of voluntary agencies in providing meeting places. Lord Morrison of Lambeth, a pioneer of municipal government discusses the role of the community and the program concludes with an extract from an interview with the famous psychoanalyst Professor Carl Jung when he was 85.

results.title: Aida
results.brief_description: This production of Verdi’s much-loved masterpiece was a triumphant success when it opened at La Scala in December, 1985 and Luciano Pavarotti’s long awaited performance as Radames was greeted with rapturous applause. In this live recording of that production Pavrotti heads an exceptional cast, with Ghena Dimitrova, Maria Chiara, Nicolai Ghiaurov and Juan Pons, all in peak form. Lorin Maazel conducts the Orchestra of La Scala, Milan. Rated: G

results.title: Ah...we humans
results.brief_description: A non-narrated, animated cartoon with humorous sound effects, giving an understanding of how people react when confronted with behaviour patterns different from their own. Deals with a number of concepts related to groups and conflict: cultural awareness, beliefs and ignorance, scarce resources and the value of alliances. No other credits available.

results.title: Aging
results.creator_credit: Peter Jordon, CRM Educational Films and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description: Examines some popular, although often mistaken, attitudes towards the aged and their places in life. Discusses two major theories: the activity theory and leisure world with Dr Vern Bengston of USC and the disengagement theory.

results.title: Aggression - assertion
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Moral Decision Making”.
By showing causes and expressions of aggression and self-assertion in a family and neighbourhood situation, this film aims to motivate classroom discussion. When assailed by the hostility of his brother and unable to retaliate, Joe goes off with his friends. In the course of their walk Joe see a radio on top of a garbage tin and becomes embroiled with Ed who also wants possession of the radio. Various responses which people might make in this situation are depicted.
